Well, It seems that my own solution rebelled against me: 😄 

```
Could not resolve all dependencies for configuration ':core:runtime'.
> A conflict was found between the following modules:
   - org.scala-lang:scala-library:2.11.11
   - org.scala-lang:scala-library:2.11.6
******   
Could not resolve all dependencies for configuration ':core:runtime'.
> A conflict was found between the following modules:
   - org.scala-lang:scala-library:2.12.2
   - org.scala-lang:scala-library:2.12.0   
```
My primary proposal was overzelous after all; I'll settle for a simple solution.
looks like this PR is still having issues, I'll rebase again and see if that helps

Hello @ijuma , can you or someone check this pull request please ?
I created a readData in ZkUtils, and refactored to Admin utils a little to use pattern match instead of the if and eliminated the null.

Hello,

I believe I've added a test that verifies that the change by @simplesteph is correct. I've confirmed that without his fix, this test does not pass.

Disclaimer: The test is not exactly pretty. It required spinning up an `ExecutorService` to replicate a long running commit.

The test is available here if someone would like to merge it into this work: https://github.com/smarter-travel-media/kafka/commit/9569a0407e50f45615f02d845aa9172165b0f1a2

Alternatively, I can open a new PR with this commit and @simplesteph's work if that's easier.

Please let me know if there's anything you'd like me to do or change. Thanks!

@dguy For now could we override the settings in `topologyBuilder#addGlobalStore` to set enableLogging to false? Anyways if people are OK with this PR for just adding a verification unit test and ignoring for now I can merge as is.
retest this please
@guozhangwang it is too late by then. The `StateStore` is already built with logging enabled and there  is no way to turn it off
Merged to 0.10.2. @enothereska could you manually close this PR?

> @guozhangwang it is too late by then. The StateStore is already built with logging enabled and there is no way to turn it off

Got it. Then I agree that it is better to change the param to `StateStoreSupplier`, which needs a KIP. Maybe we can do that in a single shot when refactoring all the stateful APIs regarding `state store supplier`.

@dguy about your main concern with materialization, I don't think it's an "either or". I think an (eventual) optimiser needs to have both options at hand (use storage, or re-compute) and chose the right one. So I don't think the materialization implementation will go away. I can add the view as part of this PR, or later as we see how people use it.
cc @hachikuji

The second assignFromUser unassigns and reassigns. We don't throw any exception, we just exercise the else block of fetchedRecords with an unassigned partition. That will ensure that we catch with a unit test if anyone adds an unprotected call to a method that requires an assigned partition.

We could also add an integration test, but they are much slower.
I see, thanks. LGTM.
I will remove the last commit and extract it into an own PR, too.

@junrao Thank you for the review.
I have run the performance tests on my laptop with high request quota configured. Again, there was no noticeable difference.
Producer (100 bytes): trunk: 151.33 MB/s   requestQuota: 155.78 MB/s
Consumer (100 bytes): trunk: 332.32 MB/s   requestQuota: 339.64 MB/s

Also started a system test run with the latest level of code: https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/system-test-kafka-branch-builder/855/
Updated this. (removed one cleanup commit)

Hi, I notice that why to use Long.MAX_VALUE is as the comment, it need to enter loop to re-build connection repeatedly.

I think should not replace Long.MAX_VALUE for custom setting, but should return status code to user when failed at first time. (default is making a exception message when having log4j configuration, but silence when not having configuration)

ping @norwood @dguy for reviews.

The reason that I think it is safe to remove the listener is that with either log truncation and log compaction, we can actually prove that after replaying the lru store's image will not contain any unexpected records, i.e.: any record that will show up in the restored lru will definitely be in the original lru, even with `delete` operations supported in the lru store. I'd omit the proof here but we can chat offline if you are interested.

With that, I think we then do not need to log the evicted records anymore from the changelog topic, and it is safe to just remove this piece of logic here.
@junrao Please kindly review the PR. Thanks.

Some of my system tests were failing from KAFKA-5100 so I just now rebased on top of trunk and kicked off another system test job.

Call for review @enothereska @dguy @guozhangwang 

Found by chance: if `sourceName` and `processorName` are the same, we loose one of both in `nodeFactories`. (Guess, most people use DSL so nobody hit this up to now...)
